calculation_formulas.description: Mathematical formulas and adjustments for calculating proper arrow spine based on bow setup variations

arrow_length_adjustment.description: Adjust spine for arrow length different from 28 inches
arrow_length_adjustment.formula: For every 1 inch longer than 28: add 5 lbs to bow weight calculation

point_weight_adjustment.description: Adjust spine for point weight different from 125 grains
point_weight_adjustment.formula: For every 25 grains heavier than 125: add 5 lbs to bow weight

carbon.description: High-performance carbon fiber arrows with excellent consistency

aluminum.description: Durable aluminum arrows with good straightness

paper_tune_left.symptoms: Paper shows tear to the left
paper_tune_left.root_causes: Arrow spine too weak, nocking point too high, arrow rest too far left
paper_tune_left.solutions: Move to stiffer spine, lower nocking point, move rest right

paper_tune_right.symptoms: Paper shows tear to the right
paper_tune_right.root_causes: Arrow spine too stiff, nocking point too low, arrow rest too far right
paper_tune_right.solutions: Move to weaker spine, raise nocking point, move rest left

bare_shaft_tuning.equipment_needed: Paper frame, bare shafts, fletched arrows
bare_shaft_tuning.step_by_step_guide: 1. Set up paper frame 2. Shoot bare shaft 3. Analyze tear 4. Make adjustments
